Posts.Content: Originally Posted by newporter Being an athlete and in good shape should help you recover from surgery faster than most. However, it is better to err on the caution side when it come to vigorous exercise after surgery. The surgeon will rearrange your plumbing and internal organs and it takes time to heal. Hernia and stitches coming apart could be messy. My doc told me not to lift anything over 5-10 lb for 4 weeks, not to do any vigorous exercise for 6-8 weeks and to avoid fly (risk of deep vein thrombosis) long distance for 2-3 months. I think you are right. When you finish prostatectomy you should rest for a period of time, it will help your body recover. Violent games cause your internal bleeding, is not conducive to health. Because the person is in motion when the secretion of adrenal hormones, the prostate also will work, so that it can not get rest. You can exercise appropriately.
